Recap: At Towers, Olivia runs into Ava who tells Olivia that she got the new doctor placed on Emma's case. Ava asks Olivia why she hates her so and that Olivia doesn't know anything about her. She begins to tell Olivia about how she misses her mother as she held her when she died. Olivia remembers her own conversation with her mother the day she died, goes berserk and fights with Ava, pushing her on the balcony outside Towers. Coop arrives and saves Ava. Later, Olivia goes to Emma's room and the doctor tells her that the treatment options are limited for Emma. Olivia looks horrified and tells Buzz that she cannot lose another child. She remembers once again the conversation with her mother. A very young Olivia, obviously pregnant, tells her mother that she cares more for her child than she (her mother) ever cared for her.
Dr. Baker tries to catch Jonathan and Tammy in bed, but cannot. Jonathan tells Tammy that maybe it's time to cool things between them for they will be caught by Alan.

Billy arranges for Reva to play in a poker game to win money to give to Josh for the medical bills. She cleans house by telling the men at the game that she has cancer, they believe it, fold their cards, she tells them it was all a lie, and wins huge. Cassie finds out that Reva didn't sign the divorce papers. Josh goes to Reva's room and Billy and she arrive with a suitcase of money which Reva spills on the floor in front of Josh.
Transcript: Olivia: She looks like she's just sleeping, like she could wake up any minute.
Doctor: And she could.
Olivia: Nothing has changed.
Doctor: That is not necessarily a bad thing. The coma is the body's way of healing itself.
Olivia: Thank you. I don't know how much more I can take.
Buzz: Take as much as you have to.. A couple of hours could make a huge difference.
Olivia: I don't want to sleep. I think I'm going to wake up and she's not ...
Buzz: Don't ... don't you think it.
Olivia: Yeah. Hey, you know what, baby? Mama's gonna go and get some of that fancy mac and cheese you like at Towers.
Buzz: I'd offer to go, but if I step away from this place it would mean a huge difference to you. You go and I'll stay.
Olivia: Okay. Thank you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Remy: Hey, you, what are you doing here?
Ava: Alan-Michael had a business meeting.
Remy: Fancy-schmancy.
Ava: Fancy-schmancy, that's me. Alan-Michael is good to me. I feel kind of bad about working, considering Emma's still in the hospital. How did everything go with Dr. Waller?
Olivia: How do you know about Dr. Waller?: I had a little hand in him taking over Emma's case.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: Whoa. No
Cassie: No. This is me trying to say that I am sorry for being so hesitant and difficult.
Josh: I understand, you don't have to explain anything, alright, I just think that we need to talk.
Cassie: We will talk. We'll talk about everything. Come on, don't you think this is a better idea?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Billy: What are you doing up?
Reva: I can't nap.
Billy: You're not going to get anywhere just looking at that. Either sign them or don't sign them.
Reva: I can't sign the divorce until I come up with the money for the medical expenses. An
Billy: I have one more idea, but I've been reluctant to mention it.
Reva: Why?
Billy: It's risky.
Reva: What do you want me to do, rob a bank?
Billy: No, but when you hear my idea, you'll think robbing a bank is a good idea.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dr. Baker: Gotcha! Smile! I had a tip that you and your ex...
Jonathan: You had a tip? Obviously your information is wrong, you get the hell out of here before I throw you out.
Dr. Baker: The question is if you aren't with Tammy, what are you doing in Tammy's room?
Jonathan: That's none of your business.
Dr. Baker: Alan Spaulding's business is proving this marriage is a sham.
Lizzie: That's it, I'm calling the cops.
Dr. Baker: So it is just you two. Nobody else is here.
Jonathan: Do you see anybody else?
Lizzie: You know, you're not even allowed to be in the room with us.
Dr. Baker: You're in Tammy Winslow's room. Why would I think you'd be in Tammy's room? Why are you in Tammy's room?
Lizzie: Sex.
Dr. Baker: What?
Jonathan: Sex.
Dr. Baker: You come down to Tammy's room to have sex?
Lizzie: We're newlyweds, we do it anywhere and everywhere. We came down to see Tammy and she wasn't here, so we got busy. Would you like some details or maybe a little show?
Dr. Baker: All right, I'm going. But we all know that Alan is not going to let this go as long as he thinks Lizzie's baby is in danger.
Jonathan: Uh-huh. And you'll be watching us, right? Blah, blah, blah. Get out. Get out, Dr. Baker. Bye, Dr. Baker.
Tammy: Well, that was fun.
Jonathan: It was kind of. He really thought he had us this time.
Tammy: Lizzie, you're good.
Lizzie: I'm the best.
Jonathan: How did you even know Dr. Doom was coming up to the room?
Lizzie: I saw him pulling into the parking lot out of the window.
Jonathan: How did he even know I was in here? Are you okay?
Lizzie: Yeah. I just feel a little dizzy.
Jonathan: Lizzie, hey, what's wrong?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: Come on, come out of it, kid. Your mom loves you so much. It's like she would take a bullet for you. I don't blame her.
Coop: Hey, Pop. No change?
Buzz: No change. How's Ava?
Coop: Terrified. Guilty.
Buzz: I'm sorry. I'm sorry about this whole thing. I'm sorry for what it's doing to us.
Coop: It's not-- it's not going to do anything to us.
Buzz: She'll come out of it, and things will start getting better.
Coop: Olivia go home to try to get some rest?
Buzz: I tried to talk to her, but she just... she wanted to go over to Towers and get some... what?
Coop: I've got to get my helmet and stun gun and get over there, Pops.
Remy: I've got to go. You two play nice, okay?
Ava: Olivia, I was just trying to help.
Olivia: Did I ask for your help? I'm pulling the doctor off the case.
Ava: Why would you do that? Stop it, stop it. You're being stupid. You don't have to thank me. That's fine. Alan-Michael knows him and is trying to help.
Olivia: And what did you offer Alan-Michael in return?
Ava: He's Emma's uncle.
Olivia: You're just trying to ingratiate yourself to the Cooper's.
Ava: Why do I need to do that? Why do you do this? You make everybody hate you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: You want me to what?
Billy: Look, I know these guys...
Reva: Oh, every time a sentence starts with "I know these guys," it means trouble.
Billy: These guys have a roaming poker game, and it is very high stakes and very low profile.
Reva: I can only imagine.

Billy: You don't know them. They're all from out of town. All they care about is the size of the amount of cash you bring with you. As a matter of fact, the game is close today. In fact, it is very close. I think that is kind of kismet, don't you?
Reva: You're saying because this game is high stakes, I could possibly win back enough cash to pay off the medical bills?
Billy: And then some.
Reva: Or I could lose any money I do have and Josh will certainly find out my medical condition.
Billy: I told you you'd prefer robbing a bank.
Reva: It gets worse and worse-- gambling in order to divorce the man I love.
Billy: I didn't say it was a good plan, but it will definitely work. So, what do you say?
Reva: I say luck be a lady tonight.
Billy: (Laughing)
[SCENE_BREAK]

Josh: Uh-huh. Okay, okay, okay. First of all, um, it would be really great if you would kiss me like that every time we see each other, say, "Hello," "Good- bye," every time we're together. But having said that ...
Cassie: Josh, look, I don't know what the future holds for us. I know we have a ton of obstacles to deal with. Now that Reva signed the papers, I don't feel like I am betraying...
Josh: She didn't sign the papers. Reva and I are still married.
Cassie: The divorce isn't going to happen?
Josh: Oh, it's going to happen.
Cassie: But she didn't sign the papers.
Josh: She didn't say no.
Cassie: Well, she didn't say yes, did she? Don't you think this is Reva holding out hope the two of you are going to get back together?
Josh: No, I don't, really. Reva has a thing for lost causes, but she also knows when the writing is on the wall.
Cassie: No, no, she wants you back, Josh.
Josh: No, she doesn't.
Cassie: Of course she does.
Josh: No, Cassie. Look, Reva and I will love each other until the day we die. That's a fact.
Cassie: I know that.
Josh: But that love is about things we've gone through. It is not about some possible future we might have together. Reva, she doesn't love me in that way anymore, and the feeling is mutual.
Cassie: How can you be so sure about that?
Josh: I just am.
Cassie: Then why didn't she sign the papers?
Josh: I don't know. She made some typical Reva excuse. I can't tell you that I understand.
Cassie: Maybe she is stalling.
Josh: It doesn't matter. It doesn't matter, because it doesn't change the way I feel. I'm ready to move on.
Cassie: And if she's not?
Josh: Okay, all right.
Cassie: What?
Josh: Come here.
Cassie: Where are we going?
Josh: I think you know. We need answers, right?
Cassie: Bad idea.
Josh: You and I are a good idea. That much I do know.
Cassie: She might not agree with that.

Josh: Cassie, we've had to fight to be together every step of the way. We've had to fight other people's perceptions, we've had to fight Hawk and Billy and Reva, but it was worth it. It's worth it. And the fight's not over, so just come with me, okay?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Billy: Hey!
Henderson: Billy! How's it going?
Billy: Every day above ground, you know what they say.
Henderson: Pull up a chair. We'll deal you in.
Billy: Well I have somebody in the hall. You wouldn't mind dealing this young lady in?
Henderson: Billy, we usually like to know who we're playing with.
Billy: She's good people. I'll vouch for her.
Henderson: I don't care if she is the pope. I like to know who I'm playing with. The table's full.
Reva: Well how do ya like that. Here Billy talked you guys up and they're nothing but a bunch of nervous nellies.
Henderson: You'd be nervous, too, if you knew what the stakes were.
Reva: Gentlemen, well, now, if you're worried about what I bring to the table...
Henderson: Well, what do you know? A spot just opened up.
Reva: What do you know?
Man: I'll take that.
Reva: Thank you.
Henderson: So what do you play?
Reva: Well, I kind of like that game called Texas hold 'em. But it was the only one I could figure out watching celebrity poker on TV.
Henderson: So you learned how to play watching television?
Reva: Yes, I sure did. But it looks like it will be a heck of a lot more fun in person.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: Maybe climbing down from our room wasn't that good of an idea.
Jonathan: I still wonder how Dr. Baker found out I was in this room.
Lizzie: Get there quick and you'll catch the guy in bed with someone who's not his wife. I think I'm a little winded from all of that fake sex we've been having.
Jonathan: Lizzie, we're going. I want to hear someone tell me you're okay.
Lizzie: Um, Tammy, you really think you should go? I mean, if Dr. Baker is going to be watching your room all night, we kind of said you weren't here.
Jonathan: This guy is really starting to piss me off. She's right, you should probably stay here.
Tammy: But I want to go with you guys. If Lizzie needs something...
Jonathan: All right, all right. But let us go to the hospital and just stay here until you think the coast is clear and then you can follow us, okay?
Tammy: Perfect. Hey, what are you doing? Good, I really need your help.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: Go ahead, hit me.
Olivia: Don't tempt me.
Ava: Hit me again. Get it out of your system, and then maybe we can talk like adults.
Olivia: God...
Ava: Tell me something. Why do you hate me so much?

Olivia: Why do I hate you? Why do I hate you? Why do I hate you? Let's start with the fact you're a phony. You wrap men around your bony little finger, and you almost took my daughter away from me. Do you even understand what that means?
Ava: You don't know anything about me. Do you know my worst memory?
Olivia: I hope it still hurts!
Ava: Holding my mom in my arms and begging her not to leave me when she was dying. I know something about hurt.
Olivia: You don't love me, you never have. You don't even want me. I hate you. Mom, mom, mom!
Ava: I think about hurt every day, and I know that you're hurting, and it is more than just Emma, I know that. But, believe me, why don't you let me help you? Just stop.
Olivia: Shut up, shut up. You want to know why I hate you, because I do. I want you gone!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Crystal Chappell, "Inside The Light."

Olivia: I am goal-oriented and fierce, and I will do whatever I can to protect my family and the people I love. If I wasn't an actor, I would probably be locked up somewhere. You know what? I'd be a lawyer. It is probably the same thing as being an actor. See Olivia, Wednesday, September 20, "Inside The Light."
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: What are you doing?
Olivia: You ruined my life.
Ava: No, I didn't!
Coop: Olivia, get off of her. Are you crazy?
Olivia: She kept pushing and pushing until I had to push back.
Coop: Over the side of a building?
Ava: Coop, it's fine.
Coop: We're sorry about what happened to the baby, but this has got to stop.

Olivia: That's right, take her side. I have a daughter in a coma. Emma may never wake up. And I have that Springfield blogger crucifying me. I've got this pixie up my nose. I guess I'm getting what I deserve.
Ava: No, no, let her go. It's over! It's over!
Coop: No, Ava, it is not over. It is not going to end until something like this happens again.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: I told you it was nothing to worry about.
Jonathan: Yeah, well, next time you feel weird I'll drive you right back down again.
Lizzie: Thank you.
Jonathan: For what?
Lizzie: For caring so much about me and the baby.
Jonathan: You don't have to thank me for that. It's what I'm supposed to do.
Lizzie: Since when do you care about what you're supposed to do?
Jonathan: Since they put "Daddy to be" on my business card.
Lizzie: Well, I think it's sweet.
Ms. Vaughn: Elizabeth Spaulding?
Lizzie: Yes?
Ms. Vaughn: I'm Ms. Vaughn from the Department of Social Services.
Jonathan: You're hired to report to the judge on Lizzie's competence case. So why are you here?
Ms. Vaughn: To make sure Lizzie's baby is not in any danger.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dr. Baker: Make sure Ms. Vaughn frames the questions right. Lizzie and Jonathan will have no problem answering to implicate themselves.
Remy: Sir, are you a guest of the hotel?
Dr. Baker: No I am not.
Remy: Mind telling me why you are loitering in the hallway? We've had complaints of a stalker walking the hallways. You seem stalkerish to me.
Dr. Baker: Stalkerish? Well... all right, I'll go, Officer.
Remy: You would be surprised what people do when you take out your handcuffs.
Tammy: I've got to get to the hospital.
Remy: I'll drive. I can go really fast.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: You have a key to Billy's room?
Josh: Yeah, well... Hello, is anybody home?! I had a key when he was drunk. And when he got sober, I kept the key, just in case.
Cassie: I don't think there is anybody here.
Josh: Well, we'll wait. It's obvious, Josh, she hasn't given up on you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: All right, gentlemen...
Henderson: You might want to think about quitting now, little lady. Leave while you still have some money left in that briefcase.
Reva: No, I'm just enjoying being around all you handsome gentlemen.
Billy: You want to sit this one out?
Henderson: Hey, no coaching from the sidelines. Sit back and enjoy the... what are you drinking these days, Okie?
Billy: I'm just drinking soda.
Henderson: We've got plenty of that.
Reva: I'm not afraid. I'm just getting warmed up.
Henderson: She's a big girl.
Man: I'm out.
Reva: That's a shame. Maybe if you're nice to me next time I'll deal you some decent cards.
Henderson: What is your story, honey?
Man: Yeah, what do you do?
Reva: Well, not much since I was diagnosed.
Henderson: Diagnosed?
Reva: Uh-huh. Cancer.
Henderson: You're kidding.
Billy: She'll show you her scars, if you like.
Henderson: How bad?
Reva: Not good. Let's see now, what do we have here? Not much of anything. Maybe kings high, a couple of pairs, who knows? It's up to you, big boy.
Henderson: Back to this cancer thing, are you...?
Reva: Terminal? Well, that's what I'm here to find out. You see, I came out of desperation to raise enough money for my treatment.
Henderson: So you're broke, and you're here gambling what you have left today?

Reva: Well, you've probably noticed how conservative I've been. Oh, yeah. Oh, golly. I actually haven't even told my kids. No one. I just thought maybe I could beat this thing on my own, even if it kills me. I'm all in.
Billy: What are you going to do?
Henderson: I fold. It's all yours.
Reva: Oh, thank you! Oh!
Henderson: I have to know what you had. A big hand, right?
Reva: Well, I don't know. That depends...
Henderson: You were bluffing with your cancer treatment money?
Reva: No guts, no glory.
Billy: We can cash these chips in right now, right?
Henderson: Yeah.
Billy: Good.
Henderson: Are you really sick?
Reva: Nah, I'm healthy as a horse, and a lot richer, too.
Henderson: I knew it. You're good.
Reva: Thank you.
Henderson: Play with us next time we hit town. I want to get my money back.
Reva: Well, gentlemen, thank you very much. Thank you, thank you. Thanks.
Henderson: Feel better.
Reva: (Laughing) I will.
Billy: You did good. How much do you think you won?
Reva: I would imagine enough to give Joshua what he wants.
Billy: Are you sure that's what he wants?
Reva: It's what I want for him.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: So what? Reva has a picture of me.
Cassie: Yeah, a framed picture.
Josh: It doesn't prove anything.
Cassie: It proves she's not over you.
Josh: You don't know that.
Cassie: You can't tell me having this here doesn't mean something? She couldn't sign the divorce papers. Obviously she has feelings for you.
Josh: Cassie.
Cassie: I don't know how to move forward with this. If seeing this here doesn't make you think twice you're doing, you're just kidding yourself.
Josh: Where are you going? Cassie! Cassie! Cassie!
[SCENE_BREAK]

Olivia: I'm sick of you judging me, Mom. I can't even breathe when I'm with you. It's like you're putting a pillow over my face trying to smother me. Olivia's mother I'm trying to make you understand.

Olivia: Why don't you try to understand me for once? Stop judging me and trying to change me. All I want is a life of my own. Dr. Waller, I wasn't expecting to see you here. You ran the tests. What can you do for my daughter?
Dr. Waller: Not much, I'm afraid.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: This is all just a misunderstanding. You know how expectant dads can be, over-reacting, and Lizzie felt a little something and I forced her in the car to get it checked out.
Lizzie: I'm fine. The baby is fine. It was a happy ending.
Jonathan: She is just so darn excited to make sure everything is right for our kid, you know, sometimes she overdoes things a bit.
Ms. Vaughn: You mean like climbing out a hotel window.
Lizzie: It wasn't a window. It was a terrace.
Jonathan: Who told you? Baker?
Lizzie: Oh!
Jonathan: You're on Alan's payroll, too.
Ms. Vaughn: Mr. Randall, let's stick to Miss Spaulding...
Jonathan: You have a file on us. How about you? I guess you're registered as a social worker. You want us to go into your bank account and find out how much money the Spaulding's are paying you?
Lizzie: What are you going to tell the judge?
Jonathan: She is not going to tell the judge anything. You get out of here. If I find out you filed a damaging report, if I so much as sniff you in our lives ...
Tammy: Is everything okay?
Jonathan: It's fine.
Tammy: Who was that?
Lizzie: Alan paid off a social worker to mess with us.
Tammy: Did she?
Jonathan: Yeah, but it's no big deal. What's up, Officer Remy?
Remy: Not much, just helping where I'm needed.
Tammy: He got me out of the hotel. He's on our side.

Jonathan: Thank you. I'm sorry about that. It's just everything going on, it is getting out of hand. I don't even know who I can trust anymore. We get rid of one person, and then there's another one. I hate doing this to you.
Tammy: Well, we knew this was going to get rough.
Jonathan: I don't know, it's just getting more complicated every day.
Tammy: Jonathan...
Jonathan: We could lose this baby. I know what this is doing to you. You need to have a police escort to leave your room.
Tammy: So what are you saying?
Jonathan: I'm saying that ... I think you and I have to cool it for a while.
Tammy: We've been sneaking around, but we've been managing, and it's kind of fun, right?
Jonathan: Yeah, I know. But it just right now stopped being fun. It's not a game.
Tammy: I know. I would never do anything to put your baby at risk.
Jonathan: I know that. But the pressure right now, you can't get away from it. I feel like it is a matter of time before we get caught. I mean if Lizzie didn't warn us tonight...
Tammy: I know.
Jonathan: And who knows what that social worker is going to say to the judge? You know you are my world. And I would do anything and everything in my power to keep us together.
Tammy: I know.
Jonathan: I just... I feel like the only way to do that and to keep this baby... I mean, we have to make the marriage to Lizzie look as real as possible.
Tammy: Okay, let's go back to the room and figure it out.
Jonathan: I can't. We can't go back to the room together. We can't do anything together. Even talking like this is a risk.
Tammy: You're right. So how long? How long do we have to wait?
Jonathan: I don't know. I don't know how long I can last. I'll, um... I'll get a message to you later on.
Tammy: We'll be okay. After all of this, it's going to be just you and me again.
Jonathan: You're damn right.
Remy: I'd ask if you're okay, but friends know.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: That was pretty incredible.
Jonathan: What?
Lizzie: What you did in there. Tammy is the love of your life.
Jonathan: Yeah. Yes, she is. Let's get out of here.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Coop: Here. If I hadn't gotten here in time...
Ava: If you hadn't gotten here in time, I know this is hard to believe, but I don't think she would have pushed me off.
Coop: You're right, that is hard to believe. Ava, all she talks about is the Springfield Burns blog, and her past. What is all that?
Ava: I don't know. Does it really matter right now?
Coop: Maybe we should try to understand it.
Ava: What good is that going to do?
Coop: Ava, by understanding her past, maybe it will help us understand all of her quirks, all the craziness she's doing. What was on that page? What did it say?
Ava: It just said something about Springfield mom not putting her family first. What does that mean?
Coop: I don't know what it means. But obviously it means something to Olivia.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Olivia: You're tops in your field. You're saying there is nothing we can do?
Dr. Waller: Unfortunately the tests we ran didn't come back with the results we hoped for. There are very serious limitations to the type of treatment for Emma.
Buzz: So there is no telling when she is going to wake up?
Dr. Waller: I have a few more options to look into, but right now our best hope is that she is strong enough to come out of it on her own. I'll keep you informed.
Olivia: Limitations? I can't feel my legs. This can't be happening, not to my baby.
Buzz: She's going to pull out of it.
Olivia: What if she doesn't?
Olivia's mother: All that matters is what you want. You are so selfish.

Olivia: If I don't take care of what I want, who will? You know something, maybe I don't have everything all figured out, but I know what I don't want. I don't want to be trapped in a dead-end life, Mom. I don't want to be you. Go ahead and cry, Mom, because I'm not apologizing. You don't love me. You never have. I already care more about this baby, my baby, and its future, way more than you have ever cared about me. I can't lose another baby. Not again. I promised myself, never again. Never again.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Billy: You know, I've been around a long time, and I have never seen anybody use terminal cancer to help a poker bluff. You're shameless.
Reva: Well, I never had much use for shame, and this bag is heavy.
Billy: Well, it won't be for long.
Reva: I know. Now I can sign the divorce papers and send Josh and Cassie on their happy little way and say good-bye, with nothing standing in my way except my heart.
Billy: I'm sorry that this big win had to turn into losing in the end.
Reva: Well, you know what I keep thinking?
Billy: What?
Reva: Somebody had to win. Why not let it be Josh, you know? The whole thing sucks, but we can take the money and...
Billy: (Laughs) Yeah.
Reva: Joshua.
Billy: What are you doing here?
Josh: Well, I could ask you the same thing.
[NEXT_ON]
Dinah: I forgot how much fun meaningless sex is.
Jeffrey: Yeah, well, I'm happy I could oblige.
Blake: Just cut the lawyer talk and remind me I still have what it takes.
Olivia: I should have listened to her.
Buzz: Who?
Woman: You can't handle this. You're too young and selfish to raise a child. It will only suffer because you're its mother.
